name.en: Department of Estonian and Comparative Folklore

structural_unit_name.en: Department of Estonian and Comparative Folklore

description.en: The course discusses the relationship between folk belief and institutionalized forms of religion. It offers analytical approaches and conceptual tools for making sense of supernatural encounters and their representations.
description.et: Kursus käsitleb rahvausundi ja institutsionaalse religiooni suhteid erinevates kultuurides. Tutvustatakse analüüsimeetodeid ja mõisteid, mis võimaldavad üleloomulike kogemuste ja vastavate pärimuste mõtestamist.

objectives.en: This course is designed to introduce students to the theories and methods in the study and interpretation of folk demonology across cultures. The course also introduces a comparative/critical model of looking at the key issues of analyzing and interpreting supernatural experiences and their expressions in folk religion.
objectives.et: Kursus annab ettekujutuse erinevate rahvausundite demonoloogiliste kujutelmade uurimise teooriatest ja meetoditest. Kursus tutvustab ka üleloomulike kogemuste je nende folkloorsete väljendusvormide kriitilisi ja võrdlevaid käsitlusi.

learning_outcomes.en: At the end of this course the student will have gained insight into key concepts and critical issues of discussing demonological beliefs from the perspectives of folkloristics and religious studies.
learning_outcomes.et: Üliõpilane õpib tundma folkloristika ja religiooniteaduse mõisteid ja analüütilisi töövahendeid, mille abil uurida ja mõtestada rahvausundi demonoloogilisi kujutelmi.

independent_work.et:
For every classroom meeting, one to three articles will be assigned. Students should be ready to discuss these texts and link them to the topic of the lecture.
Individual work will consist of reading articles, watching videos, and doing written assignments.

grade_preconditions.et:
1)	Participation in lectures – as much as possible. (If you miss more than three lectures, you should write a summary of the required readings – around 200-300 words about every text assigned.)
2)	Reading the required texts.
3)	Written assignments. You will have to do the written assignments and participate in online forum discussions.
4)	Each student should make one oral presentation in the classroom (around 10 minutes) to introduce one of the recommended articles. Students may also suggest a different text that is connected with the classroom discussions. However, this should be approved by the instructor. Alternatively, students may opt to write a critical review of one of the recommended readings (around 1 page)
5)	Final mini-essay. (Instructions about the mini-essay will be given later.)
6)    Final exam.

grade_evaluation.et: Final grade: written assignments and participation in forum discussions 10%, oral presentation or written review 10%, mini-essay 30%, final  exam 50%.

A.et: an outstanding and particularly broad-based level of achievement of learning outcomes, characterized by the free and creative use of knowledge and skills

B.et: achievement of learning outcomes at a very good level, characterized by purposeful and creative use of knowledge and skills. In terms of more specific and detailed knowledge and skills, non-essential and non-principled errors/ shortcomings may appear

C.et: achievement of learning outcomes at a good level, characterized by purposeful use of knowledge and skills. Uncertainty and inaccuracy manifests in more specific and detailed knowledge and skills

D.et: achievement of learning outcomes at a sufficient level, which is characterized by the use of knowledge and skills in standard situations, deficiencies and uncertainty manifesting in exceptional situations

E.et: achieving the most important learning outcomes at the minimally permissible level, which is characterized by the use of knowledge and skills in limited ways in standard situations, noticeable deficiencies and uncertainty manifest in exceptional situations

F.et: the learner has acquired knowledge and skills at a level lower than the minimum level.

debt_elimination.et: has to be agreed upon with the tutor

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)
